2. Panic disorders: This is a mental health condition characterized by recurrent unexpected panic attacks and fear of having more panic attacks, even when the person is not having an attack. The attacks are sudden episodes of intense fear or discomfort that reach a peak within minutes and include at least four of the following symptoms:
   - Palpitations, pounding heart, or accelerated heart rate
   - Sweating
   - Trembling or shaking
   - Shortness of breath or feeling smothered
   - Chest pain or discomfort
   - Nausea or abdominal distress
   - Feeling dizzy, unsteady, lightheaded, or faint
   - Chills or hot flashes
   - Fear of losing control or going crazy
   - Fear of dying
   - Numbness or tingling sensations
   - Choking feeling
   - Feeling detached from oneself or reality
